result.execSummary:
The defendant Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Fourth Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with COUNT 2 and COUNT 3

PROBATION for 18 MONTHS if defendant successfully completes conditions of probation within that time.
Branch 28 for probation review. Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2024 at 09:00 am.
Court Ordered sex offender registration for 7.5 YEARS; Court STAYED the sex offender registration if defendant successfully completes 18 months of probation.

miscConds.notes:
No unsupervised contact with children 10 years of age or younger.
No contact with victim or victim's family.
Upon successful completion of 18 months probation, no new law violations; Court will allow for expungement and sex offender registration/STAYED.

Obtain/maintain full time employment OR part time work and schooling OR full time schooling.
Obtain High School Diploma; if defendant unable to obtain High School Diploma, then defendant to obtain GED/HSED.

Provide DNA Sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at $0.00.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez.  Attorney Keneth Olstinski for Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 2 and COUNT 3, with credit for 4 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS; PROBATION for 18 MONTHS if defendant successfully completes conditions of probation within that time.

AS TO COUNT 2.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1 and COUNT 3, with credit for 4 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS; PROBATION for 18 MONTHS if defendant successfully completes conditions of probation within that time.

AS TO COUNT 3.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to COUNT 1 and COUNT 2, with credit for 4 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS; PROBATION for 18 MONTHS if defendant successfully completes conditions of probation within that time.
 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-No unsupervised contact with children 10 years of age or younger.
-No contact with victim or victim's family.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment OR part time work and schooling OR full time schooling.
-Obtain High School Diploma; if defendant unable to obtain High School Diploma, then defendant to obtain GED/HSED.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during the period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court Ordered sex offender registration for 7.5 YEARS; Court STAYED the sex offender registration if defendant successfully completes 18 months of probation.

*Upon successful completion of 18 months probation, no new law violations; Court will allow for expungement and sex offender registration/STAYED.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Court ordered case adjourned for hearing in Branch 28 for probation review.  Hearing scheduled for March 14, 2024 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
State has filed an Amended Information.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to all amended counts:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of   GUILTY  as to all counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.  Bail conditions to remain as previously set.

Clerk:  jms

State has filed an Amended Information:

Count 1:   FOURTH DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, a class A misdemeanor, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats.

Count 2:   FOURTH DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, a class A misdemeanor, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats.

Count 3:   FOURTH DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT, a class A misdemeanor, contrary to sec. 940.225(3m), 939.51(3)(a) Wis. Stats.
Jury Instruction - filed with plea questionnaire
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez in court with Attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court there may be a resolution to this case prior to trial.
Discussion with the parties. 
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 25, Judge Rothstein. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 25.   All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 046248,
Payable Number: 1006100,
Receipt Number: 22RP019213,
Amount: $20.00
Remaining balance of  bail to be returned to surety

Defendant Brayan Vallecillo-Hernandez in court with Attorney Cherella.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Rothstein, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  VHM, No contact with kids under 13 except his siblings and at school
